Title: SARG: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
Synopsis:
Multiple stack-based buffer overflow vulnerabilities were discovered in
    SARG allowing for remote code execution.

Background.Text: SARG is the Squid Analysis Report Generator.

Description.Text: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in SARG. For further information please consult the CVE entries referenced below.

Impact.Text:
These vulnerabilities might allow attackers to execute arbitrary code via unknown vectors.

NOTE: This is a legacy GLSA. Updates for all affected architectures are available since April 18, 2009. It is likely that your system is already no longer affected by this issue.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All SARG users should upgrade to the latest version:
